meanings.definition: To become gray or to make something become gray.
meanings.sent1: The old photograph slowly grayed over time.
meanings.sent2: The colorful painting grayed as it aged.
meanings.sent3: The vibrant flowers grayed after being left in the sun too long.
meanings.sent4: The once bright sky grayed as storm clouds rolled in.
meanings.sent5: The hair of the elderly man grayed gracefully with age.

meanings.sent1: The fabric grayed after multiple washes.
meanings.sent2: The sunset slowly grayed as night approached.
meanings.sent3: The once vivid painting grayed in the dimly lit room.
meanings.sent4: The fire's embers grayed as they burned out.
meanings.sent5: The colorful leaves grayed as autumn set in.
